page.title: 06POPULATION OF MITCHELDEAN
page.content: The gradual closing down of the local mines and other traditional industries of the area in the early and middle part of the 20th century led to a decline in the importance of Mitcheldean, so that by 1958 the population had dropped to around 800. After this date the expansion of the Rank Xerox factory led to much new building. A council estate was followed by two private estates, one of considerable size. This attracted many newcomers, not only from other local towns and villages, but from many parts of the British Isles. A survey amongst a group of schoolchildren showed that out of every 7 families, 3 families had moved into Mitcheldean from outside the Forest of Dean area within the last 12 years.
